title: How are actors doing shows during lockdown? - Quora

response.answer_text: BBC says: “Since Covid-19 closed auditoriums worldwide, theatres have been picking tapes of shows from the library shelf to stream online for those feeling play-starved. But a few performers are attempting something more radical - regularly live streaming performances from home. There’s an audience - but it’s not easy to make the technology work.” So I suppose that’s how they’re doing shows during lockdowns :)

During the actual lockdown production was stopped on both movies and TV. However the full lockdown has been over since the beginning of the summer, and I imagine everything is back in production. There are deadlines and obligations which must be met. I haven’t heard of anyone in the entertainment business industry, other than Tom Hanks and his wife having been infected this summer, but it may have happened.

One of our local theatres has begun doing shows from their rehearsal room, which has large windows that face the street. (It was formerly a store.) During rehearsals, the windows are covered, but now they are open. The audience sits on socially distanced chairs on the sidewalk, the sound is piped outside on speakers, and the performers perform inside, wearing masks.

Actors like John Krasinski are finding ways to connect online with their fans and figuring out what content to put out on YouTube. It is not like they are sitting around waiting for the next big thing to come and find them.
